alert.note: Alert for Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Newberry and northeastern Saluda Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Greenwood State Park, or 14 miles east of Greenwood. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newberry, Prosperity, Newberry College, Silverstreet, Chappells, Stoney Hill, Chappells Fire Station, Newberry County Detention Center, Fairview Fire Station, Vaughnville, Mid-Carolina High School and Wyses Ferry. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 76 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
